io.debezium.relational.ddl

Class LegacyDdlParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.debezium.relational.ddl.AbstractDdlParser
      • io.debezium.relational.ddl.LegacyDdlParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DdlParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DdlParserSql2003, MySqlDdlParser

    @NotThreadSafe
public class LegacyDdlParser
extends AbstractDdlParser
implements DdlParser
    A parser for DDL statements.

      • LegacyDdlParser

        public LegacyDdlParser(java.lang.String terminator)
        Create a new parser that uses the supplied DataTypeParser, but that does not include view definitions.
        Parameters:
        terminator - the terminator character sequence; may be null if the default terminator (;) should be used

      • LegacyDdlParser

        public LegacyDdlParser(java.lang.String terminator,
                       boolean includeViews)
        Create a new parser that uses the supplied DataTypeParser.
        Parameters:
        terminator - the terminator character sequence; may be null if the default terminator (;) should be used
        includeViews - true if view definitions should be included, or false if they should be skipped

      • parseSchemaQualifiedName

        protected java.lang.String parseSchemaQualifiedName(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Parse the next tokens for a possibly qualified name. This method builds up a string containing the schema name (or if none is found the the current schema), a '.' delimiter, and the object name. If no schema name is found, just the object name is returned.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        Returns:
        the qualified schema name.

      • parseQualifiedTableName

        protected TableId parseQualifiedTableName(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Parse the next tokens for a possibly qualified table name. This method uses the schema name that appears in the token stream, or if none is found the AbstractDdlParser.currentSchema(), and then calls AbstractDdlParser.resolveTableId(String, String) with the values.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        Returns:
        the resolved TableId

      • parseQualifiedTableNames

        protected java.util.List<TableId> parseQualifiedTableNames(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Parse the next tokens for one or more comma-separated qualified table names. This method uses the schema name that appears in the token stream, or if none is found the AbstractDdlParser.currentSchema(), and then calls AbstractDdlParser.resolveTableId(String, String) with the values.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        Returns:
        the resolved TableId

      • parse

        public final void parse(java.lang.String ddlContent,
                        Tables databaseTables)
        Examine the supplied string containing DDL statements, and apply those statements to the specified database table definitions.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface DdlParser
        Parameters:
        ddlContent - the stream of tokens containing the DDL statements; may not be null
        databaseTables - the database's table definitions, which should be used by this method to create, change, or remove tables as defined in the DDL content; may not be null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is a problem parsing the supplied content

      • parse

        public final void parse(TokenStream ddlContent,
                        Tables databaseTables)
                 throws ParsingException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Examine the stream starting at its current position for DDL statements, and apply those statements to the specified database table definitions.
        Parameters:
        ddlContent - the stream of tokens containing the DDL statements; may not be null
        databaseTables - the database's table definitions, which should be used by this method to create, change, or remove tables as defined in the DDL content; may not be null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is a problem parsing the supplied content
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the supplied token stream is in an invalid state

      • parseNextStatement

        protected void parseNextStatement(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse the next DDL statement. This is the primary entry point for subclasses.
        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • parseComment

        protected void parseComment(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse the a DDL line comment. This is generally called by parseNextStatement(io.debezium.text.TokenStream.Marker) for line comments that appear between other DDL statements, and is not typically called for comments that appear within DDL statements.
        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • parseCreate

        protected void parseCreate(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse the a DDL "CREATE" statement. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses.

        By default this method simply consumes the complete statement.

        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • parseAlter

        protected void parseAlter(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse the a DDL "ALTER" statement. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses.

        By default this method simply consumes the complete statement.

        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • parseDrop

        protected void parseDrop(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse the a DDL "DROP" statement. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses.

        By default this method simply consumes the complete statement.

        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • parseUnknownStatement

        protected void parseUnknownStatement(TokenStream.Marker marker)
        Parse a DDL statement that is not known by the parseNextStatement(io.debezium.text.TokenStream.Marker). This method can be overridden by subclasses, although it will be more common for subclasses to override parseNextStatement(io.debezium.text.TokenStream.Marker).

        By default this method simply consumes the complete statement.

        Parameters:
        marker - the start of the statement; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is an error parsing the statement

      • consumeStatement

        protected void consumeStatement()
                         throws ParsingException
        Consume all tokens from the current position that is a starting-statement token until either the end-of-statement terminator token or before the next starting-statement token.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if the next token is not a starting-statement token

      • consumeRemainingStatement

        protected void consumeRemainingStatement(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Consume all tokens from the current position until and including either the end-of-statement terminator token or one of the tokens that is registered as the start of a statement.
        Parameters:
        start - the marker at which the statement was begun

      • consumeBeginStatement

        protected void consumeBeginStatement(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Consume the entire BEGIN...END block that appears next in the token stream. This method may need to be specialized for a specific DDL grammar.
        Parameters:
        start - the marker at which the statement was begun

        Returns:
        the quoted string; never null
        Throws:

        Returns:
        the quoted string; never null
        Throws:
        ParsingException - if there is no single- or double-quoted string at the current position

                             java.lang.String msg,
                             java.lang.Throwable t)

        Parameters:
        position - the position at which the error occurred; may not be null
        msg - the leading portion of the message; may not be null
        t - the exception that occurred; may be null

      • parsingFailed

        protected void parsingFailed(Position position,
                             java.util.Collection<ParsingException> errors,
                             java.lang.String msg)
        Generate a ParsingException or MultipleParsingExceptions with the supplied error or errors and the supplied message, which is appended by this method with additional information about the position's line and column.
        Parameters:
        position - the position at which the error occurred; may not be null
        errors - the multiple parsing exception errors; may not be null
        msg - the leading portion of the message; may not be null

      • parseColumnsInSelectClause

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Column> parseColumnsInSelectClause(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Parse the column information in the SELECT clause. This statement stops before consuming the FROM clause.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        Returns:
        the map of resolved Columns keyed by the column alias (or name) used in the SELECT statement; never null but possibly empty if we couldn't parse the SELECT clause correctly

        protected java.lang.String determineTypeNameForConstant(long value)

        protected java.lang.String determineTypeNameForConstant(float value)

      • determineTypeNameForConstant

      • parseColumnName

        protected void parseColumnName(TokenStream.Marker start,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tableAliasByColumnAliases,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> columnNameByAliases)
        Parse the potentially qualified and aliased column information, and add the information to the supplied maps.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        tableAliasByColumnAliases - the map to which is added the column's alias (or name) keyed by the alias of the table in which the column should appear; may not be null
        columnNameByAliases - the map to which is added the column's name keyed by the its alias (or itself if there is no alias); may not be null

      • parseSelectFromClause

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Table> parseSelectFromClause(TokenStream.Marker start)
        Returns the tables keyed by their aliases that appear in a SELECT clause's "FROM" list. This method handles the various standard joins.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the statement
        Returns:
        the map of resolved tables keyed by the alias (or table name) used in the SELECT statement; never null but possibly empty if we couldn't parse the from clause correctly
